page.title: 01IMPRESSIONS OF THE AREA
page.content: This area has 2 or 3 little communities, a lot of woodland, and a lot of open countryside which is farmed. Most of the people we spoke to were very friendly and helpful, but there were some who were very rude and did not help us at all. We noticed that every house seemed to have a dog. The land is mostly split up into two big estates - one has 2500 acres and another 1000 - and big farms. There is a PGL adventure centre for children down at Hole-in-the-Wall by the river, which is perfect along this stretch for canoing and fishing. The PGL base is where there used to be a toll gate and a pub for the bargees when there was barge traffic on the Wye. It is really peaceful and beautiful along this bit of river, but only the PGL children ever visit it. That seems a pity.
